column6: 3 El Thawra Council St Zamalek, Cairo Egypt
column7: On the southern tip of Gezirah Island, the hotel is a corner of paradise in central Cairo, minutes from Cairo’s business districts. A stroll along the hotel’s lush riverside promenade takes you to a host of acclaimed restaurants and bars. You can take your time, enjoying the cool shade of exotic palms and breathing in the scent of hibiscus. You’ll hear the gentle sound of water lapping as you rest on a Nile-side terrace with a cool drink, and dine on international cuisine. It’s especially beautiful at dusk, when the sun sets over Cairo’s skyline and vibrant nightlife. Escape the city for a day at our secluded Cairo hotel, which feels like an exclusive Egyptian resort set in lush gardens. Take advantage of Sofitel SPA and Sofitel FIT, float in an infinity pool overlooking the Nile, unwind in a bubbling whirlpool bath… whatever you desire. Day membership includes discounts to the restaurants and bars which line the Nile-side promenade, promising refreshment and fun for families, couples and friends.

column6: 26 Mahmoud Bassiouny Rooftop, 7th Floor, Talat Harb Sq, Cairo 11511 Egypt
column7: Dahab Hostel, Your Oasis in the City... It has been open since 1998. It has been registered in all the major guidebooks and has consistently received positive reviews. Dabab Hostel is centrally located in the heart of Downtown Cairo. It is just a 3-minute-walking distance to the Egyptian Museum in Tahrir Sq., and within easy reach to the main train and bus stations. Dabab Hostel has its own special charm. It is a collection of whitewashed huts on the rooftop attempting to recreate the feel of Sinai beach camp in an unremittingly urban Downtown Cairo. Once you get inside, you will definitely sense the totally laid-back, chilled out and cozy atmosphere. The outdoor garden area is just superb for lounging around and catching up with other travelers in the evening. The breeze is refreshing and the vibe is incontestable. It is an ideal place for artistic travellers as well. Enjoy the fantastic reggae music played, laying back in the sun, smoking Shisha 'Water pipe' on the rooftop at the Bedwin corner. Sit back & relax, plan your itineraries & catch up with your family & friends by logging onto our new optimized FREE WiFi Broadband Internet coverage for the entire hostel. Our rooms are equipped withprivate facilities and A/C. We have single, double and private dorms available and there are 39 rooms in total. Airport Pickup Service Once you have made your booking, you will be contacted by a staff member to organize it with you. At the airport, you will find our representative waiting for you holding a sign of your name and Dahab hostel, after you finish passport checking and custom clearance. Things to see in the local area Shopping Bazars. Khan El-Khalili Market. Al Azhar Mosque. Old Cairo /Islamic Cairo. Coptic Area. The Citadel. Cairo Tower. Cairo Opera House. In the evenings, the local area has a wide variety of restaurants and lively nightspots. Thank you for choosing Dahab Hostel ... See you soon in Cairo... ...::: NEW :::... Check out our new Deluxe rooms with private facilities and A/C

column5: 1 El Tahrir Sq. Downtown, Cairo 11511 Egypt
column6: I love this little hotel. I often stayed there as a single woman in Cairo, and they always took good care of me! I have spent hundreds of days there over the last 30 years. I spent a lot of 2020 here, as my apartment was being renovated. The staff made me feel it was my second home.  The hotel is thoroughly cleaned every day. It was redecorated in the last couple years. The building is 1920s style, with high ceilings, balconies with great views of the city, ceiling fans, and lots of charm. The old, original elevator works well--it might take some getting used to, but it is regularly maintained, so you can count on it. If it ever does not work once, the owner gets it checked right away, because he won't be able to stay in business without it. If you find the stairways dirty or the airshaft dirty--these things are typical in Egypt and not something the hotel can do anything about, since they own the eighth floor, but not the building.  The owner, Ashraf, is very kind and accommodating to your needs, as well as an excellent source of information about any where you need to go, how to renew your visa, how to open a bank account, and whatever else you need. The staff are respectful and very honest.   Breakfast is bread, cheese and jam, plus an egg! Most budget places in Egypt don't include an egg. Cold drinks, water, tea and coffee are available at cheap prices. If you want to order a full Egyptian breakfast, it is excellent and not very expensive. Plus with the app "Talabat," you can order from hundreds of area restaurants, if you don't feel like going out. Reception staff can help you order.  There are two suites with AC and a bathroom inside. The other rooms can some with a bathroo or you share the bathrooms, but many are available and cleaned multiple times a day. The bathtubs are clean, but old. It's time to redo the porcelain on them. But they work well and are clean.  You can hang out in the reception area to meet other travelers. They are mostly students, budget travelers an occasional businessman from Saudi. If you want any tour, Ashraf can arrange it, as well as transportation wherever you want, including the airport. He is very honest, which is sometimes not easy to find in Egypt.  The location is the best! Busses and a Metro stop are right in front of you, while taxis are plentiful and not expensive. There are new Uber busses or Svwl busses or cars you can book on apps for fair prices.  The balcony views of Tahrir Square, the Egyptian Museum or the old American University of Cairo campus are fantastic.  Bring earplugs, because Cairo never sleeps, so everywhere is noisy all night.â€¦

column6: I spent 3 nights at the Royal Maadi Hotel (previously known as Residence Hotel). The service was the best, better than any 5 star- literally. Any issues, they come right away, the housekeeping was extremely helpful and on top of everything with personalized service, the concierge very helpful, and the reception very polite and courteous. When my daughter got stain on the walls the manager was very courteous and accommodating. They also brought for me flowers and fruit per my family's request.  I took a 3 bedroom suite which was an apartment. Each bedroom had a queen size bed. There was also a dining area, salon area, kitchen, and bathroom. The style was a bit outdated but the availability and convenience of everything made up for it. There was microwave, fridge, toaster, oven, kitchenware, ironing board, tv, and desks.   I appreciated the cleanliness- everything was covered in plastic and sanitized.   Breakfast was very basic with boiled egg, jam, bread, cheese, OJ, tea/nescafe.   Delivery is easy through talabat app where I ordered things from the pharmacy and other restaurants. The hotel is keen about safety so no delivery persons come to the room, instead the concierge will carry up the item and you give him the money. I made sure to leave a tip for both him and the person delivering.  There are also a few restaurants and cafes downstairs although I didn't try any. One is particularly famous in Maadi for breakfast called Ovio (?).  The location is quiet, removed from the hustle and bustle of Cairo, and a view of trees and greenery specific to Maadi. I loved the balcony to relax in.   I totally recommend this hotel for short or extended stay. Special thanks to Mr. Sayed the manager, Ms. Asmaa the receptionist, Ms. Heba the housekeeper, Mr. Nour/Nouh the concierge. Excellent service and help from them.â€¦

Some of the rooms have a great view to Tahrir Square - ask, if they are available. The biggest advantage of the hotel is the location - walking distance (5 min.) from the Egyptian Museum, close to the Nile, next to the metro station. The staff can speak english and are really helpful.

With direct access to Stars Centre shopping mall, and just a seven-minute drive from Cairo International Airport and Cairo International Convention and Exhibition Centre, our 140 fully furnished studios and suites place travelers where they need to be. The buzzing streets of downtown Cairo are half an hour away, with the Great Pyramids a little further. Business travelers on extended stays in Cairo can settle into a spacious studio or suite with up to three bedrooms. Full kitchens and living areas let you cook, work and entertain in style, and Wi-Fi is complimentary throughout. A free buffet breakfast sets you up for the day, and an Evening Social invites you to mingle with fellow guests over dinner three nights a week.

column5: 42 Talaat Harb Street, Cairo 11511 Egypt
column6: Unbeatable location, spotless clean room and bath, extremely hospitable hosts - I couldn't ask for more! I checked in late (around 11pm) and it was a smooth process - thanks to Mr. Umar - one of the hosts. Mr. Umar is always happy to share words of wisdom from his decades of experience and I really appreciate all the food and travel tips I got from him! Mr. Ibrahim, the other host is a resourceful and energetic young man. This cool dude gave me loads of tour options (even for other cities like Aswan and Luxor), helped me exchange currency, arranged transportation. Between them and the very helpful Moustafa and Mary there's always someone at front desk, eager to assist.  There's a ton to do around this area. One can walk over to the the Museum, Tahrir Square, Nasr Metro Station, Bo Bus station or the Nile in about 10 minutes. My room was surprisingly quiet considering the busy location! The railway station is about 1km away. Countless shopping and food options in the neighborhood - from touristy to very local stuff!  The general vibe at the hotel is very welcoming, laid back and casual. They serve breakfast and even offered to customize it for me. There's a shared kitchen and plenty of seating in the lobby. The wifi is not the best, though it was being hogged by a few guests streaming videos all day. I found an unused wifi router in the hallway and set it up as a range extender. The hosts were immensely grateful!  Made some great connections with the hosts and fellow travelers as I lounged about the lobby, sipping some of their amazing shaay :) Special mention for Ahmed - the dashing young man who drove me all around Cairo, Giza, dropped me to the train station and even invited me for a home-cooked meal! Mr. Omar and Ibrahim are ambassadors of Egyptian hospitality. They made me feel like a guest and not a customer. It was almost too good to be true! They actually convinced me to return to Egypt! I'll certainly stay again at Mr. Umar and Mr. Ibrahim's placeâ€¦

column5: 171 Mohamed Farid St Downtown, Cairo 11511 Egypt
column6: Nitocrisse Hotel is located down town Cairo. The location places you in the heart of Cairo. All the touristic attractions are in the vicinity or effortlessly within reach from the Hotel. The Egyptian museum is a 10-minute walk, Islamic Cairo is the same distance, and the railway station is two kilometers far. The Tahrir square where you can pick any transportation means to all touristic sites is also a 10-minute Walk.Our small 45-room hotel is located on the 5th and 6th floors with four efficiently operating lifts. The hotel was established in 1955 and since then we have been trying to offer a service typical of a small family business. Our residents normally get quickly familiar with our friendly personnel who are keen on offering the best they could with respect to cleanliness and room service. We also have our homey kitchen and chef trained and experienced in Egyptian, oriental recipes together with well-known French and Italian dishes. Our dishes are competent price-wise compared to many of the nearby classical restaurants. For those who might not be interested in eating in the hotel, there are plenty of varied choices ranging between classical restaurants and more economic coffee-shops and chains, many of which are at a short walking distance-between 3 to 5 minutes . Amenities include restaurant, room service, 24 hour front Desk, lift/elevator, Air conditioned rooms, TV, laundry service...etc.

column6: This lovely hotel is a hidden gem just inside the walls of the old part of Cairo. This is where you will immediately feel you are part of Cairo street life with all its amazing colour and energy in a way you never would in one of the smart hotels in the modern part of Cairo. The minute you walk out of the door you will be in the vast ancient souk full of life and colour. The building used to be a soap factory which the owner discovered in ruins and has built into a delightful boutique hotel. Itâ€™s a true community enterprise because on the ground floor are artisan craftspeople working in separate little workshops - silversmiths, weavers, woodworkers etc- you can enjoy watching them at work and buy their beautiful creations if you like. The staff are absolutely lovely - nothing us too much trouble for them. This place feels more like a home than a hotel. Highly recommended!â€¦

column5: 23 Abd El-Khalik Tharwat, Cairo 11511 Egypt
column6: In a nutshell : a must go! The rooms are big and clean, the beds comfortable.  The breakfast is good and cheap - as like a lot of Amazing egyptian food !! The location of the hostel is very good, within walking distance of a lot of nice buildings and museums. And the staff is INCREDIBLE! They are so nice and understanding and welcoming. We really felt good there.

column6: The Egyptian Night Hotel is located across the street from the Egyptian Museum in the famous area of Downtown, Cairo , the area that was built in the 60'S of the 19th century by one of the most remarkable Kins of Egypt (Khedive Ismail) as he intended to build it to be architecturally similar to the famous Cities in Europe back then and he did it. Here we have all of our rooms Air conditioned with inside bathrooms, 24 hot water, Mini bar, Flat screen TV, Safe & our service contains multi lingual staff speaking (English, Spanish, French, Portugese & Chinese) who will be glad to help you 24 hours. We have also Free airport pick up if you are staying more thank 3 nights and our travel desk are glad to help you set your tours, transportation, restaurant reservations and ready with recommendations based on our experience and guests feed backs. Egyptian night hotel. Where expectations meet reality. Note : all rooms includes breakfast.

column6: After amazing stay in Cairo with great people everywhere, we have booked a queen room with a private spa and private balcony to finish our stay with a nice stay on the Nile. The owner asked us to do the check-in in the ground floor, to pay (we trusted him) then to go the 20th floor to see our room. When we arrived to the 20th floor, the construction works were juste beside our room (photos attached). There was no private spa in the room and we need to cross the construction works to reach the "common" balcony ... We refused the room, and asked about something else, he told us that was the last room he has ... So we asked to cancel the reservation and to refund us the 140 â‚¬ that we have just payed. The owner accepted and told us that he will refund us the full amount. Now one month later, the owner didn't refund us anything, he didn't answer my messages, my calls and my emails. We asked Booking. com to intervene, but Booking couldn't do anything as the owner asked us to pay by card in the hotel when we arrived, Booking considered the paiement has been done directly with the hotel. What a shame to have such an hotel in the "Preferred Partners Properties" Programmes of Booking.com. It is a real scam, the owner is not honest, what a shame for the nice Egyptian people to have such a scammer.â€¦

Il bagno Ã¨ rifatto da poco, quindi moderno anche se con qualche piccola pecca. Forniscono solo il sapone ma danno le ciabattine. La colazione viene servita in una terrazzina proprio sul fiume, con tanto di ventilatore. E' una colazione egiziana solo salata con dei falafel e le omelette cotte al momento, formaggio, verdure, pane egiziano e the o caffÃ¨. Il personale Ã¨ stato molto gentile, ci hanno accolto a notte fonda e l'autista che Ã¨ venuto a prenderci all'aeroporto ( per 18 euro) Ã¨ stato molto cordiale con un'ottima guida. Zona tranquilla. Certamente ci vuole un po' di spirito di adattamento, perchÃ¨ la pulizia non Ã¨ proprio agli standard che ci si aspetta e alcuni mobili sono un po' malandati (o coperti di cellophane, non so perchÃ¨!) ma in generale per il prezzo che ha ritengo sia una buona scelta di fascia  economica.â€¦

column5: 2 Bostan Ibn Qurysh, Cairo 00202 Egypt
column6: Avoid at all cost! I arrived late in the day only to find out that they did not have my pre-paid room available. Just hours before my arrival I had whatsapped them to make sure that everything is fine and they lied to me saying my room would be waiting for me. When I arrived, they said they have no room and would give me a room in a sister property which looked much worse. I asked them if they can organize a stay in a nicer hotel and they refused. Just to make sure: I had a confirmed reservation, just saying this again! Also, the lobby looks not even close to what they show online. Avoid at all cost.

column5: Ali Al Kasar Street, Cairo 29022 Egypt
column6: The hotel is very centrally located, near Attaba metro station. It is very clean compared to what you find outside on the streets, so if you want your oasis of cleaness in Cairo, you have found it. The staff is very friendly, always helpful and welcoming. Mr. Robert will always check up with you to see if you are ok or need anything. Breakfast is basic but hearty. They will not be pushy to sell you any tours as other hotels do. They really care about the guests needs and even did the laundry for free without accepting any money for it. The housekeeping is sometimes too loud on the corridor early in the morning.

column5: 8 Gawad Housny 3rd Floor, Cairo 11511 Egypt
column6: I chose KMT Hostel since I needed a cheap place to sleep for one night in Cairo.  It's well located - I walked there from the bus station.  There are restaurants nearby and the metro is close.   My bunk bed was comfortable and roomy, though I suspect the room gets crowded when all the beds are taken.  The bunk has a personal plug, light and a shelf.  Bathroom was clean with good showers.   I left early, so didn't try the breakfast.  The hotel owner was my taxi driver to the airport, very easy.  I wish there was an indoor lounge with no smoking allowed. FYI there is no outdoor space, which would be a pain for a longer visit.  Front desk staff seems hit or miss.

column6: Simply the worst hotel Iâ€™ve stayed at in 40 years. The only concern they had about me as their customer was the payment. But they couldnâ€™t even handle a credit card machine. Well, one of the very unprofessional staff could but only after three days of my visit and when the machine was finally charged and could accept US Dollars, not Egyptian pounds (which worked everywhere else with my card). That was the start when arrived late first night. The room didnâ€™t look ready at all, no toilet papers, no safety box, the mini bar was totally empty, no balcony as the description lied about. When I woke up it was even worse. Easily the dirtiest hotel ever. The bedclothes were ripped, had dirty stains AND pubic hair all over (in the shower as well). Smashed mosquitos/bugs on the walls, and the windows behind the curtains, jeez, I got almost sick only by looking how dirty they were. See picture. No organization whatsoever when it comes to clean up the room, if you donâ€™t ask them nothing happens. After three days one of the staff asked me to change room since â€Iâ€™ve got a friend coming overâ€. Well, what about NO my friend I answered. The electricity went out about five times during my week, oh, and I left this horrible place in complete darkness since the lights went when I was just about to leave. column5: 118 Mohammed Farid Street, Cairo 00202 Egypt
column6: My stay at Velvet 1889 was the worst hotel stay of my life so far. The receptionist refused giving me bed covers and told me to turn the A/C on instead. It is February, and it's Cairo nights are incredibly chilly. When I contacted the customer service, they told me the same thing and the A/C would be more than enough! I felt completely humiliated and dehumanised. The bedsheets had body hairs stuck to them and the towel I was given was already wet. I had to cut my stay short and leave the hotel at 12 a.m. to go and look for somewhere else where I could even have the luxury of having blankets. When I came out of the room, I found that the receptionist was putting together bedsheets for me to use as make-do blankets. The experience was disappointing through and through. They did not even once apologize or show any vague understanding of human needs, such as having a warm place to sleep in in such a harsh winter!â€¦

column6: Wonderful place in the very center of the City. In a nice 1900 Italian style building, a soulful "pensione" furnished with taste with vintage furniture and kept with a lot of care by the same owner for 50 years and her staff, always available. Spacious rooms with high ceiling and hardwood floor, each one has its own decoration and spirit, some with balconies with columns. Many different configurations available, just ask: with AC or ceiling fan (we tried both, fan was enough even in summer), with or without shower and toilets in the the room (but the communal bathrooms are also very clean), all with at least a sink, single, double, double + single bed for families, on the street (vibrant city vibe) or on the back lane (very quiet). Very clean, comfortable and functional. Same for the communal spaces, large TV salon and dining room. Possible to order lunch and dinner too. Great vintage atmosphere, a lot of charm, an experience out of timeâ€¦

column5: 20 Sakkara Road Abu Sir, Cairo Egypt
column6: Despite it is a nice and clean guesthouse with a beautiful garden, Mohamed the owner is the greediest person I have ever met. He attracts you with a decent room price and free pick-ups but once you get there you'll pay exagerated prices.  - He charged me the breakfast even though on his website was clearly written that breakfast is included in the price of the room.  - For a soup and two pieces of chicken meat at lunch he charged minimum 7$, then he obviousely got very frustrated when he saw I bought food from the village the next days (as if I had to eat only the meals cooked by his family so that he could charge me more).  Pay attention because he is not telling you the prices at the beginning, he says "yes yes no problem", and at the end he claims exagerated prices (at least double than normal).  The climax was when I insisted to know the price for horse riding beforehand and he said 80$ for 2h (something absurd!) When I said I don't have so much left, he insisted going to an ATM as if I had to do that horse riding with him. The next day he insisted on giving him all my change because apparently I didn't need it because I was flying back home. He didn't care I had to pay toll road for my car, eat something before my flight, he only wanted more money for him, not caring of his guests needs (and decision).  I was happy to leave and wouldn't return there not even for free. It was the worst experience I had in Egypt. Mohamed is interested only in grabbing as much money as possible from you (at exorbitant prices). My advice is don't go there.â€¦

Only point i had flagged during my stay were some internet connection issues which was solved after 2 days and a bit more cleanliness of the apartment before handing over to the guest ( properly vacuuming and  changing the bedsheets and towels). Apart from this you will feel righr at home! Would definitely recommend and come back :)

column6: This hotel was a discovery for me! I originally booked a neighbor hotel, but when I arrived there at 3:00 AM they told me they were overbooked and had no room for me. Richmond House was the closed one, so I popped up without a reservation and the manager on reception was more than helpful. He only had one room available for just one night, so he let me take it with a good rate. He advised me to check again next day, and luckily they had a cancellation, so I continued my stay in another room.  Both rooms were clean, nicely furnished in a traditional style. Beds were very comfortable. Hot water was always available. Cleaning lady was doing a great job. All staff I met were super friendly and went out of their way to assist.  The location is convenient. If you walk out from the building, you will find many places to eat - from street vendors and fast food chain (KFC is 5 minutes walk) to decent restaurants. Tahrir Square and Egyptian Museum are around 15 minutes walk.  I definitely recommend this hotel for a budget stay!â€¦

column5: 3 Abdel Azim Rashed St., Cairo 11511 Egypt
column6: The Regency Hotel in Cairo is located in the Giza suburb of Dokki a fair walk from downtown Cairo on the west bank of the Nile, aka the crappy side. It is off a busy highway & around the corner from a ladies club. If this doesnt raise your suspicions about this being the wrong Regency Hotel perhaps the hand painted hotel sign will.  Room 506 has seen better days about a decade ago. After enjoying the release of emptying my bowels the toilet wouldnt flush & there wasnt any toilet paper. There was a 28cm tv, mini fridge & aircon. Bedsheets looked sort of gungy & the carpet was fairly dirty. The reception dudes spoke little english but knew how to ask for tips. I played a game of charades with them to try & explain the toilet problem. It was very entertaining, we eventually changed rooms to an equally poor room.  The hotel is housed in the sort of neighbourhood you would go to if you were homeless. Stray dogs & garbage are the main features here if you like to take photos. There are no computers in the hotel, the reception desk used paper & pen! The 80's has come back in fashion here.  The hotel resturant has cobbwebs on the locked door, this is probably not good so avoid even asking for food, just call KFC for takeaway 19019.  The previous review from 2 years ago basically describes our experience word for word, so in 2 years nothing had improved, indeed its pretty shabby. If you stayed here, have a sense of humour & laugh.â€¦

column6: Located at the top of a multipurpose building itâ€™s not what you might expect from an Inn. The entrance is somewhat hidden in an alley. The entrance hall is, say the least, weird. The elevator will not pass any European security check, but remember youâ€™re in Egypt. Their many gods will probably protect your journey up to the actual Inn, where an informal welcome awaits you. Your host Khaled and his twin sister will show you every courtesy one could expect. Your wish is his / their command. Like a real Egyptian genie he will bring you at the most impossible of hours a cool forbidden drink combined with the latest gossip about his vast family. Charming, entertaining, it makes you feel at home. Our room was clean and decorated Egyptian style. The bathroom was the same, however, Egyptian style in case refers to the way it was constructed. It all worked but a sense of humor was needed. In short, a nice, hospitable place with limits for a short stay at the city centre, close to King Tut. Service with a wonderful smile.â€¦

We have a 24 hour reception desk where our friendly and professional staff can provide you with travel and tourist information. Room service also is available 24 hours a day. An automatic-teller machine is located nearby our hotel. We provide free airport pickup if you're staying longer than three nights. We can arrange custom made tours for you to Giza, Sakkara, Memphis or any other place in Cairo. Trips can be arranged to Aswan and Luxor and also to the Western Desert, Red Sea, and more. price includes: tea/coffee, breakfast, flexible check-out, local and international phone calls, Wi-Fi, kitchen facilities for use, language store. Laundry service and nternet room are available. Credit cards are accepted.If you have some special requirements that are not mentioned just let us know what they are and we will get back to you with an offer. All staff of our hotel tries hard to keep guests happy and we hope that we are succeeding!

column6: Tahrir Plaza Suites is a boutique hotel inspired by ancient Egyptian history. The core theme of the guestroomsâ€™ design is based on four legendary Egyptian gods (Amun-ra, Horus, Osiris & Anubis) and two goddesses (Hathor & Isis), who were worshipped with devotion during the era of the pharaohs and who also became the center point of numerous beliefs and rituals of the ancient Egyptian religion. Unlike conventional hotels, Tahrir Plaza aims to provide guests with a unique and personalized experience. It is for this reason that the hotel has only six suites, which are entirely different from each other and were carefully decorated always caring for the most minimum details such as wall colors, bed design, bathroom tiles and more.

column6: Fairly clean, very nice staff. The AC worked, internet was decent. As a solo female, I felt very safe. I also had no problems walking around alone in the neighbourhood. The location is good. The Cairo activities were overpriced but delivered okay services. I booked the Nile dinner cruise in Cairo, a Giza pyramid tour and a 4 day Aswan/Luxor cruise.The guides were not always very thorough and I never knew what was coming next.   DO NOT book Aswan/Luxor activities through them.  I paid almost double what other people on the cruise paid(use visitor it was legit and a good price). My guides were not great and they were frequently trying to scam me. They didnâ€™t provide tour guides at more than 3 temples where I had thought I had paid for them. They didnâ€™t tell me in advance so I wasnâ€™t able to make alternative arrangements.   If you are looking for a cheap, safe, no frills place to hang out in Cairo, then itâ€™s good. If you are looking for a hotel to help you book activities, I would recommend spending the money on a reputable hotel with dedicated staff for tours or finding a tour agency. Other people on my cruise booked it through the boat or website and paid half the price and got twice as much.â€¦
